data.text: When it’s time to change the gigantic A350 engine, lots of planning, precision and many skilled mechanics are needed. We interviewed Finnair’s Powerplant Engineer Reijo Katiska to find out what it takes to change the huge engine and why it is even changed: https://t.co/ufFbdKInSo

Check your destination’s travel requirements easily in the travel restrictions map on our website: https://t.co/XzcJck2y1i. The same map is used by our customer service. We currently get exceptionally many calls and are unable to answer questions regarding travel restrictions. https://t.co/i8LjpPByHu

urls.title: Travel requirements map
urls.description: Use the interactive travel map to find out where you can fly with Finnair and what guidelines you need to follow in each destination.

urls.title: Smooth travelling at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Flying via Helsinki means that you can enjoy the compact and uncrowded Helsinki Airport, where all the gates and services are located under one roof, in one terminal building. Helsinki Airport welcomes you with its new spacious arrival and departure halls! As the main transit area for Finnair customers, the brand-new terminal will make connections extra quick and smooth. Catching a train, bus or taxi to or from the airport is now easier than ever as everything is nearby the terminal entrance. The

data.text: The renewed and stunning @HelsinkiAirport Terminal 2 welcomes you! Finnair departure hall services are gradually moving to the new building starting from today, while the new arrivals hall is open already now: https://t.co/DitKUbDa9U. Smooth travels! https://t.co/dSqwhZ0Akr

Finnair is happy to be a part of the @traveloneworld #oneworldalliance initiative to buy 350 million gallons of SAF from @aemetis for operations at @flySFO. This joint effort highlights our commitment to decarbonising aviation. Read more at: https://t.co/FlBx2XoCk4 https://t.co/MXQdCT7qLl

We bring back our inflight shopping services on 1 December! The inflight trolley sales are available on flights outside the EU, while the renewed and extensive pre-order selection is available for both long-haul and short-haul flights. https://t.co/FQ0HNRdYSH

urls.title: Shopping with Finnair
urls.description: Discover your shopping opportunities with Finnair and start shopping top quality brands!

data.text: Travel smoother and confirm your coronavirus certificates before your journey with a new digital tool. The service is available as of 3 December from Finland to certain countries as part of the current check-in you can do in advance. Read more: https://t.co/mUFDqnGGPX https://t.co/zDDpUyR6rh

data.text: Due to new restrictions concerning restaurants in Finland, we will start checking Covid-19 certificates at Finnair Lounges at Helsinki airport every day from 5pm starting 28 November. Please prepare to show your Covid19 Certificate at the Lounge reception. https://t.co/KIZ8BB2F9p

data.text: Finnair app is designed to give you peace of mind on the move. You can customize your flight, do your check-in, contact customer service and keep your Finnair Plus card with you. Find out how the Finnair app smoothens your journey from booking to landing. https://t.co/SBLAfDfEIq

Helsinki Airport is going through a total transformation to offer you a modern and smooth experience. Our departure hall services will gradually move to the new building starting 1 December, and the renewed arrival hall will be open already on 1 December. https://t.co/cnMldAgpmN

data.text: Did you know that by reducing the weight of your baggage by 5kg, you reduce your carbon footprint by about 5%? So how can you succeed at packing lighter and taking with you only the most essential? Check out our cabin crew’s tips for packing smart. https://t.co/gOrmtTbibo

In our simple checklist for travelling, you can find advice on what to do before, during and after your flight for travelling safely. Many health and safety measures are in place to ensure your well-being throughout the journey. https://t.co/c9LWBZrZrT

data.text: In the summer season 2022, we will fly to nearly 100 destinations. Our new long-haul destinations include Dallas, Busan and Tokyo Haneda, and Sapporo as a summer destination for the first time. In Europe, our new destinations are Larnaca and Zagreb. https://t.co/2qN3ykPKwH https://t.co/Jaz4ABOyZU

The USA is finally open for travel! ✈️🇺🇸 You can travel there if you have received 2 doses of vaccination at least 14 days before and have a negative coronavirus test result taken within 3 calendar days before your trip. Check what's required in detail: https://t.co/aNeU58WjqQ. https://t.co/vHXYhGSTFU

data.text: Finnair is a front runner in utilizing flight data to create solutions for better fleet optimization. Route and aircraft management are always done with fuel efficiency in mind, aiming to find even more efficient ways to lower fuel use and emissions. https://t.co/tNETpx30IK

Finnair complements Turku and Tampere flight connections with bus connections to lower the CO2 footprint of the route as of summer 2022. You can read more here: https://t.co/xTfvUW056n https://t.co/ebXemzt5FJ

We start co-operation with Pihlajalinna on 3 November 2021 and offer you affordable and easy access to coronavirus testing prior to travel. As a Finnair customer, you can get an RT-PCR test for €93 and a rapid antigen test for €80. Read more: https://t.co/LzGZBYEgSs https://t.co/iSnZl5raul

data.text: Today, we celebrate our 98th birthday! We hope that you have made many great memories with us throughout the years – we, for sure, have enjoyed flying you to different places around the world. 💙 We will continue our journey towards the big 100, see you on board! https://t.co/bXB2x06QbR

urls.title: How to get through the airport faster
urls.description: Save yourself some time and follow our tips to get through the airport with less stress. We recommend thinking ahead, starting from advance check-in that saves a lot of time and effort. The easiest way to check-in is with the Finnair mobile app. When you use the app, not only can you store your boarding pass, but you get real-time updates and other services such as the option to upgrade to Business Class or to purchase your seat assignment. Of course, sitting in the front of the aircraft always gives you

data.text: Even though travel restarted in Europe and Cargo had a record quarter, Q3 result was heavily negative. However, operating cash flow turned positive for the first time since Q4 2019. Read more in our Investor Relations Blog: https://t.co/tFiA2rmt4p

Less biowaste, less plastic and less aluminium. More sorting, reusing and recycling. Finnair's catering services are developing several areas within recycling and material efficiency according to the 2019 and 2020 waste audits. https://t.co/2DgAkCE2os

Our first direct flights from Stockholm to Bangkok, Phuket and Miami have departed. LAX flights will start in Nov and JFK in Dec. The Phuket flight got a water salute from our partners at @Swedavia. We are delighted to offer these new, direct connections to Swedish travellers! https://t.co/QkbsIRblyK

Flying from HEL to ARN this Fri or Sat? You might be in for a nice surprise. Flights AY819 on 22 Oct and AY801 on 23 Oct will be operated with our wide-body A350 aircraft. Our first direct long-haul flights from Stockholm are leaving this weekend. https://t.co/6g9bigL9G2

What’s it like to work as Finnair Kitchen’s Head chef and how did Japanese Koji Moriwaki end up there? For International Chef's Day, we share Koji’s story and want to thank all the chefs around the world for their valuable work. 🤍 https://t.co/RCSu6GSIY4

urls.title: Fly to over 100 destinations with Finnair
urls.description: Finnair flies the shorter, faster route between Europe and Asia. Modern fleet – more comfort, lower emissions. Search and book your flights today.

data.text: Bom dia Lisboa! 🇵🇹 We have added more flights to Lisbon for December 2021–March 2022 and adjusted our flight schedule. https://t.co/TUW5jTQnlf.
Guten Tag, Berlin! 🇩🇪 We have added one weekly frequency to Berlin for Wednesdays from 10 November 2021 to 8 December 2021. https://t.co/cXjtltiUJ3
Ciao Milano! 🇮🇹 We have added one weekly frequency to Milan for Saturdays from 20 November 2021 to 11 December 2021. https://t.co/Y44ODtfBr6

Enchanting and impressive architecture, more art than you can possibly consume during your trip and mouth-watering delicacies. The forever-favourite destination Barcelona never grows old. https://t.co/7lAyxDISyb

We have added flights to Japan for summer season 2022. From 27.4.2022, we will operate two weekly flights from Helsinki to Sapporo on Wednesdays and Sundays. To Osaka, we will have two daily flights throughout the summer season. Fukuoka flights will start on 26.4.2022. https://t.co/qRvlFZH3r3

In September, Finnair carried 298,200 passengers, which was 158.1% more than in September 2020. The number of passengers in September 2021 was 11.9% more than in August 2021. https://t.co/4rvr2xevuA https://t.co/6FrxXkKPDV

data.text:
In the Scandinavian capitals of Stockholm, Oslo, and Copenhagen you will find plenty of things that delight children and parents equally. Here are some of the best spots to visit with the whole family.
https://t.co/i5chZnr0zb

We will re-open our Finnair Business Lounge in the non-Schengen area at Helsinki Airport on 4 Oct with limited opening hours from noon to 6 pm daily. From 1 Nov onwards, the lounge is open with full opening hours from 6 am to midnight. https://t.co/lAOoa67M3e https://t.co/bXPXOFtdpL

urls.title: Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Combining Nordic design, atmosphere and hospitality, our lounges at Helsinki Airport invite you to spend a hassle-free moment before your flight. There are three lounges at Helsinki Airport – Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side and Finnair Business Lounge and Finnair Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side of the airport.

data.text: As travel is picking up, we are meeting the increased demand by adding frequencies and destinations in our network to Europe, Asia and North America for the upcoming winter season. https://t.co/d4Mkya0JT5 https://t.co/RK89s8ZOGz
